verses.text: The Lord said to Aaron, "You, your sons, and your father’s house with you, will bear the responsibility for offenses against the sanctuary. You and your sons with you will bear the responsibility for offenses against your priesthood.
Bring your brothers also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, so that they may join with you and minister to you while you and your sons are before the Tent of Testimony.
They shall keep your charge and the charge of all the Tent, but must not come near the vessels of the sanctuary or the altar, or both they and you will die.
verses.comment: Literal rendering: 'your charge and the charge of all the Tent'.

verses.text: They shall join you and keep the charge of the Tent of Meeting, for all the work of the Tent. No outsider may come near you.
And you shall keep the charge of the sanctuary and the charge of the altar, so that there may never again be wrath on the people of Israel.
Behold, I myself have taken your brothers, the Levites, from among the people of Israel. They are a gift to you, given to the Lord, to serve at the Tent of Meeting.

But you and your sons with you shall carry out your priestly duties for everything at the altar and behind the curtain. I give you your priesthood as a service of gift, and any outsider who comes near must be put to death.
verses.comment: Behind the curtain refers to service in the Most Holy Place.

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Aaron, "Behold, I have given you charge of the contributions made to me, all the holy offerings of the people of Israel; I have given them to you and your sons as a portion, as a perpetual due.

This will be yours from the most holy offerings, reserved from the fire: every offering of theirs, every grain offering of theirs and every sin offering of theirs and every guilt offering of theirs, which they render to me as most holy offerings, shall be most holy for you and your sons.
verses.comment: Literal: 'most holy for you and your sons.'

verses.text: You shall eat it in a most holy place. Every male may eat it; it is holy to you.
verses.comment: 'Most holy place' means within the sanctuary area.

verses.text: This also is yours: the contribution of their gift, all the wave offerings of the people of Israel. I have given them to you, and to your sons and daughters with you, as a perpetual due. Everyone in your house who is clean may eat it.
verses.comment: Wave offerings: Hebrew 'tenufah', offering presented and waved before God.

verses.text: All the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine and of the grain, the firstfruits that they give to the Lord, I have given them to you.
The first ripe fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring to the Lord, shall be yours. Everyone in your house who is clean may eat it.
Everything devoted in Israel shall be yours.
verses.comment: 'Devoted' here refers to things set apart for God.

verses.text: Every firstborn of all flesh, whatever they offer to the Lord, both man and animal, shall be yours. Nevertheless, you shall surely redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of unclean animals you shall redeem.
And you shall redeem their price, from one month old you shall redeem, at your valuation, five shekels of silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
verses.comment: 'Valuation' refers to the prescribed price, not a variable value.

verses.text: But the firstborn of a cow, or the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat, you shall not redeem; they are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood upon the altar and burn their fat as a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
And their meat shall be yours, just as the breast of the wave offering and the right thigh are yours.

All the offerings of the holy things that the people of Israel present to the Lord I have given to you, to your sons and your daughters with you, as a perpetual due. It is a covenant of salt forever before the Lord for you and your descendants with you.
verses.comment: 'Covenant of salt' symbolizes permanence and inviolability.

verses.text: And the Lord said to Aaron, "You shall have no inheritance in their land, neither shall you have any portion among them. I am your portion and your inheritance among the people of Israel.
To the Levites I have given every tithe in Israel for an inheritance in return for the service which they perform, the service of the Tent of Meeting.
And from now on, the people of Israel shall not come near the Tent of Meeting, or they will bear sin and die.

But the Levites shall perform the service of the Tent of Meeting, and they shall bear their own responsibility. It shall be a statute forever throughout your generations that among the people of Israel they shall have no inheritance.
verses.comment: 'Bear their own responsibility' - literal 'bear their iniquity.'

verses.text: For the tithe of the people of Israel, which they present as a contribution to the Lord, I have given to the Levites as an inheritance. Therefore I have said to them that among the people of Israel they shall have no inheritance.
And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

"Moreover, you shall speak to the Levites and say to them, 'When you receive from the people of Israel the tithe that I have given you from them for your inheritance, then you shall present a contribution from it to the Lord, a tithe of the tithe.'
verses.comment: 'Tithe of the tithe' - 10% of what Levites received was given to the priests.

verses.text: And your contribution shall be counted to you as though it were the grain of the threshing floor, and as the full produce from the winepress.
verses.comment: 'Contribution' literally 'heave offering,' an offering lifted up to God.

verses.text: So you shall also present a contribution to the Lord from all your tithes, which you receive from the people of Israel. From these you shall give the Lord’s contribution to Aaron the priest.
Out of all the gifts to you, you shall present every contribution due to the Lord, from all the best of it, the sacred portion from them.'

"Therefore you shall say to them, 'When you have offered from it the best of it, then the remainder shall be counted to the Levites as the produce of the threshing floor and the produce of the winepress.
And you may eat it in any place, you and your households, for it is your reward in return for your service in the Tent of Meeting.
And you shall bear no sin by reason of it, when you have presented the best of it. But you shall not profane the holy things of the people of Israel, or you will die.'"
verses.comment: 'Profane' means to treat as common or ordinary rather than sacred.
